questions.question: What is the meaning of this property: hmc.structure.db=false

answers.option: A change in the hmc.xml will be reflected in the HMC directly withouth a restart.
A change in the hmc.xml will be reflected in the HMC directly after a restart.
A change in the hmc.xml will be reflected in the HMC directly after a restart when you cleared the hmc settings from the database.

questions.question: Where can you define the localizations for text in the hmc.xml?

answers.option: hmc/resources/[extension package]/hmc/ocales_en.properties (but only when hmcmodule is configured in the extensoninfo.xml.)

questions.question: Which of the following tags can not be a direct child of <configuratiok>?

answers.explanation: They are used to define toolbar actions. may be used multiple times

questions.question: The order of elements (e.g. tab) is defined by:

answers.option: The attribute position can be used.
The attribute priority can be used.

questions.explanation: The position attribute is only effective during the exact moment of hMC configuration. If another hMC element with the same value for position is read after the current one, the current one will be moved to the next position. In the code snippet, Properties1 would then end up on position 5.

questions.question: Which of the following are not valid types for action.
questions.explanation: type="string" [possible values: toolbar, item, create, save, remove, searchresult]

questions.question: Which of the following elements can be a parent of the element 'group'.

answers.explanation: typeref is a chilld of exporertree

questions.explanation: type="string" [possible values: toolbar, item, create, save, remove, searchresult]

questions.question: How can you include a JSP as a node?

answers.explanation: Can be used to add a .JSP file as a node (while not using a chip class or representing a type).
Adds a given chip class as a node which does not represent a type .

questions.question: How can you modify the how an items looks like for example customer on an order?

answers.explanation: Lists a number of attributes which are shown when items of this type are referenced in other editors.

questions.question: Which of the following elements can be a child of the 'organizer' tag?

answers.explanation: Possible childs: listview, editview, treeview, action

questions.question: How can you hide an attribute in the hmc. For example a custom field on product?

answers.option: If you do not define it, it will be hidden.
Use the tag 'remove' to hide the attribute.
It is not possible, it will always be visible in the hmc.

answers.explanation: The 'exclude' and 'exclusion' (child) Tag. Contains the attributes which should be excluded (omitted) in the editor of this type. Be sure you do not explicitly add these attributes in any of the other sections!s

questions.question: How can display certain attributes on every tab of an item? (best solution)

answers.option: Copy the attributes to every tab.
Place the attributes in the 'essential' tag.
Place the attributes in the 'section' tag.

questions.question: The admin tab is an example of:

answers.explanation: In the core hmc implementation, the "Access rights" tab (in a ComposedType editor) is an example of a custom tab.

questions.question: Which tag can be used to show the unbound attributes?
